title: User wants to receive error if Waiver System dates don't exist for the year of the waiver request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request
AND one or more of the following fields does not have valid date values in the Waivers section of the System Admin> System Dates tab:
-Closed Period
-DE Closed Period
-First, Second, Third and Fourth Waiver Periods for Optional Assignment Waivers
-First, Second, Third, Fourth, and Fifth Waiver Periods for Outright Assignment Waivers
-Trade Waiver Request Period for Trade Assignment Waivers
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Waivers tab
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate blocker message “Waiver Request(s) cannot be submitted because one or more waiver dates are missing for [Waiver Type]. 
Please enter these dates and retry.”
AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the form

title: User wants to receive warning if they navigate away from the form in edit mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND has the Waivers form open in edit mode
AND user has selected a specific Org from the dropdown
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects another Org
OR user attempts to change the Request Date
OR user clicks out of the Waivers Dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN a message should display stating "You have unsaved changes. Do you wish to continue? [OK/Cancel]"
AND clicking 'OK' should cancel the changes, collapse Request Entry, and return the user to Edit mode
AND clicking 'Cancel' should keep the changes and leave the user in the open Request Entry accordion

title: BOC user wants to request waivers for Voluntarily Retired Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user 
AND user has navigated to Waiver Request Entry screen in edit mode
AND user has selected an Org from the dropdown
AND a player from that Org has a status of "Voluntarily Retired" 
BUT player has not had this status for more than 2 years from current date
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks on the Player Dropdown in Request Entry section
custom_expected:
THEN the voluntarily retired player should show up in Players Dropdown for the selected Org (For BOC only)
BUT club users should not be able to select these players or see them in their player dropdown
AND if a UR is submitted for a Voluntarily Retired player, the Release from Roster transaction should still be created as for any other player

title: User wants to receive error when submitting request for player with Full or Limited No-Trade
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in and attempting to submit a Waiver Request Entry for a player
AND selected player has a Full or Limited No-Trade Provision in their current MJC
AND user has selected an Irrevocable Waiver type (other than UR waivers, UR should not generate error)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit to BOC or Save
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate error “Ineligible Waiver Request. [Last Name], [First Name] has a no trade or limited no trade covenant in his contract, and may not have Irrevocable waivers requested for him.”
AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the form
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should ignore the error and continue (BOC Only)

title: Submit a Waiver Request Permissions - BOC - Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with BOC admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN BOC admin user attempts to do anything with a Waiver Request
custom_expected: THEN user should be able to view, create, delete, edit, and submit waiver requests for players

title: Submit a Waiver Request Permissions - BOC - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with BOC basic permissions
custom_steps: WHEN BOC basic user attempts to do anything with a Waiver Request
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view all waiver requests 
BUT user should NOT be able to make any changes

title: Submit a Waiver Request Permissions - Club - Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with Club Admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Waiver Request
custom_expected: THEN user should be able to view, create, delete, submit, and edit all waiver requests for their own players (It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the request)

title: Submit a Waiver Request Permissions - Club - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with Club Basic permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Waiver Request
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be able to view all waiver requests for their own players (It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the request)
BUT user should not be able to make any changes

title: User wants to receive notification when a request bulletin is sent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC or Club user 
AND user has navigated to the Waivers screen on Transactions dashboard
AND one or more players are found in the "Players with Submitted Requests" table
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate a Notification for users with the roles "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-VIEWERS", "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-EDITORS", or "EBIS-WV-BULLETIN-SENDERS"
AND notification Date should be equal to the current date, with the To and From Org columns blank
AND description text should read "Waiver request bulletin for [request date] is available."

title: User wants to receive clipboard notification that there are no waiver requests when Request Bulletin is sent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC or Club user
AND user has navigated to Waivers screen on Transactions dashboard
AND there are currently no players listed in the "Players with Submitted Requests" table for the selected request date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate a Notification for users with the roles "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-VIEWERS", "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-EDITORS", or "EBIS-WV-BULLETIN-SENDERS"
AND notification Date should be equal to the current date, with the To and From Org columns blank
AND description text should read "No Waiver Requests for [request date]."
AND description should not be a hyperlink

title: BOC user wants to resend notifications for a Request Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the waivers screen on transactions dashboard
AND user is viewing a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
AND "Resend Notification Emails" button has appeared on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Resend Notification Emails" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should open a pop-up where the user will be able to select the type of notification emails to resend, and the Org(s) it should be resent to
AND "All BOC" should be checked by default
AND "All Clubs" should be selected by default
AND Selecting "Select Clubs" should result in a Club dropdown appearing
AND When "Select Clubs" is actively selected, the "Club" dropdown should be a multi-select dropdown with all 30 Orgs' abbreviations available
AND if the user re-selects "All Clubs" the Club dropdown should be hidden again, and any previous selections made should be ignored
AND the "Bulletin" field should be a dropdown with the options "Request" and "Results" (but for now the only option is "Request")
AND clicking "Cancel" should close the pop-up and send nothing
AND clicking "Resend" should NOT store any changes made to the form or update the stored bulletin, but should generate a new set of notifications for the selected recipients

title: Club user wants to see Players with Requested Waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club user
AND user has navigated to the waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has been sent
custom_expected:
THEN a "Players with Requested Waivers" collapsible section should be displayed and expanded by default
AND this section should NOT be visible to Clubs prior to the Bulletin being sent
AND "Players with Requested Waivers" section should match the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND "Players with Requested Waivers" section should contain all of the players for whom waivers were requested by all Orgs for the currently selected Request Date
AND the table should be sorted by Org and then by the player's name (Last, First)
AND the "Request Entry" section should be collapsed by default
AND expanding "Request Entry" should display the players that the Club has requested waivers on for the "Request Date" being viewed
AND if no players are found in the Request Entry section, there should be a line of text stating "No Waiver Requests Found"

title: Club user wants to submit a Waiver Claim
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club user
AND user is attempting to Submit a Waiver claim
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the "Players with Requested Waivers" section of Waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN A "Claim" button should be displayed for each player submitted by another Org
BUT no claim  button should display for players from the user's Org
AND no claim button should appear for any club user if after 1:00PM ET on the Claim Expiration Date
AND clicking "Claim" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to claim waivers on the selected player
AND if user clicks “OK” the system should submit the claim for the club and in place of "claim" button, system should display date and time for which claim was made
BUT if user clicks “Cancel” claim should not be made on player and user should be taken back to claim entry screen
AND once a Waiver Claim has successfully been submitted for a player, the claim information should appear in the "Results" table for the BOC as "Claimed by ORG mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm"

title: BOC User wants to submit a Waiver Claim on behalf of a club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user is attempting to submit a Waiver Claim on behalf of a club
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Players with Requested Waivers" section of Waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN a Claim button should be displayed for all players if 'All' is chosen in Org dropdown
BUT if user chooses a specific Org, the Claim button should not appear for players from that Org
AND clicking the Claim button should launch a pop-over that allows the user to select a single Org
AND the player's Org should not appear in the dropdown, nor should any other Orgs that have already submitted a waiver claim for the player
AND clicking “Cancel” should close the popover and take no action
AND selecting an Org and clicking "Claim" should  prompt the user to confirm the claim
AND once user has confirmed they wish to proceed with the claim, modal and popover should be dismissed and user should be returned to "Players with Submitted Requests" table
AND the Claim button should remain for the player
AND if BOC user were to expand the "Results" section of form at this time, they would see "Claimed by ORG date/time" information just as though a Club had performed the Claim
AND if BOC user has entered a Claim on behalf of a club and it is after 1:00PM on the Claim Expiration Date, result should show Claim Expiration Date as mm/dd/yyyy in the result and 12:59 pm as the time in the result

title: User wants to receive error if submitting a Waiver Claim past 1PM EST on Waiver Claim Expiration Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC or Club user
AND user is attempting to submit a Waiver Claim
AND current time is past 1PM EST on the Claim Expiration Date of the current Waiver Request
custom_steps: WHEN user confirms that they wish to proceed with the claim
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error message "The claiming period for [Last Name], [First Name]'s waiver request expired at 1:00 PM on [Claiming Period Expiration Date]”
AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the form
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should ignore the error and continue with the workflow (BOC Only)

title: Club User wants to see only the Request Entry section on pending request dates
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club user
AND user has navigated to the "Players with Requested Waivers" section of Waivers screen on transactions dashboard
AND BOC has not sent out a bulletin for the selected request date
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the "Players with Requested Waivers" section of Waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should only see the Request Entry section when viewing that request date
AND user should NOT see the Players with Pending waivers requests section if the bulletin has not been sent
AND once the bulletin is sent for that date, then Clubs should view both the Request Entry and Players with Requested Waivers sections when viewing that request date

title: User wants to see the most up to date "latest transaction"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as club or BOC user
AND user is attempting to create a Waiver Request Entry
custom_steps: WHEN user loads a pending waiver request bulletin (not yet sent)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check for and display the players' latest Approved transaction, even if none was previously displayed or it differs from what was displayed when request was submitted
AND if a user has manually entered a latest transaction for the player, that should NOT be overwritten by any transaction information found by the system. The user's entry should remain
AND refreshing the page should load the latest transactions for the player(s) being viewed
AND when BOC hits "Send Request Bulletin" system should NOT check for the latest transactions, and should capture whatever current entry is and store it along with bulletin information
AND once Bulletin has been sent, system should no longer look for or update any of the list players' Latest Transaction information, but should display whatever value was stored there at the time of the bulletin being sent for the first time (to account for subsequent re-sends of the same bulletin)

title: User wants to view notification on clipboard when club has submitted waiver claim entry
custom_preconds: GIVEN a waiver request exists for a player
custom_steps: WHEN club submits a waiver claim entry on the player
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate a notification for BOC users in the roles "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-VIEWERS", "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-EDITORS", or "EBIS-WV-BULLETIN-SENDERS"
AND notification text should be in this format: "Waiver Request for [request date] – [claiming org] has placed a claim on this player"
AND the notification Date should be equal to the current date, with the Player name populated and a hyperlink to the player's history
AND description should be a link to the waivers screen for the relevant Request Date

title: BOC user wants to receive warning if there are any unsent request bulletins from 30 days prior
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC user 
AND user is attempting to send a Waiver Request Bulletin
AND  there are one or more unsent request bulletins for the past 30 calendar days from the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check for any unsent request bulletins for the past 30 calendar days from the current date
AND system should display warning message “Unsent waiver requests remain from [Pending Waiver Date(s)]”
AND clicking "Back" should close the modal and return user to the form 
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should ignore the error and continue with workflow (BOC only)

title: BOC user wants to receive an error when they send Waiver Request Bulletin if Claim Expiration Date is not later than Request Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC user
AND user is attempting to send a Waiver Request Bulletin 
AND entered "Claim Expiration Date" is on or before "Requested Date"
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should display blocker message “Claim Expiration Date cannot be equal to or before the Request Date.”
AND clicking "Back" should close the modal and return user to the form

title: BOC User wants to view a properly formatted waiver result including Eligible Org after a waiver claim
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND a Waiver Claim has been processed
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the "Results" section of waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN if only one claim has been entered, it should appear as "Claimed by *ARI 6/10/2016 12:59 " showing Date and time of claim and claiming Org
AND if more than one Org has entered a claim for a player, this should appear as "Claimed by *ARI 6/10/2016 12:59 BAL 6/10/2016 12:59"
AND an asterisk (*) should be used to denote the Org actually eligible to make the claim
AND after eligible Org, following claim Orgs should be displayed in alphabetical order

title: BOC User wants system to determine which Org is eligible when a waiver request has more than one claim entered for it - Trade Waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC or Club user
AND a Trade Waiver Request has been entered for a player
custom_steps: WHEN the Trade Waiver Request has more than one claim entered for it
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if any of the claiming Orgs are in the same League as Org that entered the Request
AND if there is only one claiming Org in the same League, then that Org should be designated as the Eligible Org
BUT if more than one claiming Org is in the same League, the Orgs NOT in the same League should automatically not be eligible
AND if no Orgs are in the same League as the Org that entered the Request, or if more than one claiming Org is in the same League, then the Eligible Org should be decided based on the lowest winning percentage of the remaining Eligible Orgs
AND if the Claim Expiration Date is within the first 31 days of the season (First Day of MJ Season system date + 30 days), then the Org with the lowest winning percentage from the prior season should be considered the Eligible Org
BUT if the Claim Expiration Date is NOT within the first 31 days of the season, then the Org with the lowest winning percentage from the current season should be considered the Eligible Org
AND if there is more than one Org that has the lowest percentage, then the system should look to the prior season, and so on until the tie is broken

title: BOC User wants system to determine which Org is eligible when a waiver request has more than one claim entered for it - Non-Trade Waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC or Club user
AND a Non-Trade (OR, UR, OPT) Waiver Request has been entered for a player
custom_steps: WHEN the Trade Waiver Request has more than one claim entered for it
custom_expected:
THEN if the Claim Expiration Date is within the first 31 days of the season, then the Org with the lowest winning percentage from the prior season should be considered the Eligible Org
BUT if the Claim Expiration Date is NOT within the first 31 days of the season, then the Org with the lowest winning percentage from the current season should be considered the Eligible Org
AND if there is more than one Org that has the lowest percentage, then the system should look to the prior season, and so on until the tie is broken

title: BOC User wants to cancel a Waiver Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the waivers screen on transactions dashboard
AND a Waiver request has been submitted for one or more players
AND "Cancel" button is displayed in the first column of the table for each player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Cancel"
custom_expected:
THEN a confirmation message should be displayed confirming the cancellation on the player [“Are you sure you want to cancel the waiver for [Last Name], [First Name]?”]
AND when user confirms, System should change Waiver Result Status to Cancelled and display, "Cancelled on [current date] (mm/dd/yyyy)", in place of request result

title: BOC User wants to modify which Org is eligible when a waiver request has more than one claim entered for it
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the "Results" Section of Waivers screen on transactions dashboard in edit mode 
AND more than one Org has claimed the same player 
AND "Update" button is visible in the "Results" column for that player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Update"
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch a popover (see wire) that allows the BOC user to select the "winning" Org
AND the dropdown available on the pop-over should only contain those Orgs that have claimed the player
AND once an Org is selected, the waiver Result should show with the "*" now in front of the selected Org

title: BOC User wants to view Waiver Claim results
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC user
AND user has navigated to Waivers screen on Transactions dashboard
AND user has selected a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
custom_steps: WHEN user has selects a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
custom_expected:
THEN the "Results" collapsible section should be available
AND this section should be open by default, with the remaining sections collapsed when the current date is equal to the Claim Period expiration date
AND the Results table should match the provided data discovery and wireframe
AND the Results Bulletin Comments text area should be available and visible per the wireframe
AND the checkbox "Automatically send this bulletin at 1:00 pm EST on the Claim Period Expiration Date" should be displayed and unchecked by default

title: BOC user wants to be able to choose which Waiver Bulletin to send
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and viewing Waivers Screen
custom_steps:
When user has selects a Request Date for which a Request Bulletin has been sent 
AND current date is equal to or greater than Claim Expiration date of Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN "Send Request Bulletin" should be replaced by the "Send Results Bulletin" split button
AND clicking the main blue button should work to send the Results Bulletin
BUT clicking the dropdown arrow should allow the user to choose to Resend the Request Bulletin instead
AND choosing to resend the Request Bulletin should work the same as the "Send Request Bulletin" button did prior to the switch to the split button

title: User wants to receive clipboard notification that Result bulletin is available
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with role:  "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-VIEWERS", "EBIS-WV-REQUEST-EDITORS", or "EBIS-WV-BULLETIN-SENDERS"
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user Clicks "Send Result Bulletin" on a submitted Waiver Request
custom_expected:
THEN user should receive a notification 
AND notification Date should be equal to the current date, with the To and From Org columns blank
AND description text should read "Waiver result bulletin for [request date] is available."

title: BOC user wants to resend notifications for Result Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waivers Request Entry Screen
custom_steps: WHEN user selects a Request Date for which Request Bulletin has been sent
custom_expected:
THEN "Resend Notification Emails" button should appear
AND clicking the "Resend Notification Emails" button should open a pop-up where user should be able to select type of notification emails to resend, and Org(s) it should be resent to
AND "All BOC" should be checked by default
AND "All Clubs" should be selected by default
AND selecting "Select Clubs" should result in a Club dropdown appearing
AND when "Select Clubs" is actively selected, the "Club" dropdown should be a multi-select dropdown with all 30 Orgs' abbreviations available
AND if the user re-selects "All Clubs" the Club dropdown should be hidden again, and any previous selections made should be ignored
AND "Bulletin" field should be a dropdown with options "Request" and "Results" both available once Results Bulletin has been sent
AND clicking "Cancel" should close the pop-up and nothing should be sent
AND clicking "Resend" should NOT store any changes made to the form or update stored bulletin
BUT clicking "Resend" should generate a new set of notifications for the selected recipients

title: BOC user wants to send Waiver Result Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC user
AND user has navigated to Waivers Request Entry Screen
AND user has selected a date for which a Request Bulletin has been sent 
AND "Send Result Bulletin" button is available
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Result Bulletin" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should store the current Result Bulletin as it currently exists
AND blue notification should display stating that the result bulletin has been sent successfully
AND screen should be reloaded in View mode, with the Org filter set to "All" and with the "Results" as the only section expanded
AND "Withdrawal Process" section should now be available for BOC users, but collapsed
AND "Edit" button should no longer be available for this Request Date
AND "Claim" buttons should no longer be available for this Request Date for the BOC or for Clubs

title: BOC user wants to receive warning if current time is before 1 PM of Claim Expiration Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and attempting to send a waiver result bulletin to clubs 
AND it is currently before 1PM of Waiver Request Bulletin Claim Expiration Date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Results Bulletin"
custom_expected: THEN system should display warning message #45

title: User wants to see any transaction on the player within the prior 30 days
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request for a player
custom_steps: WHEN user selects a player that has a tx in his history during the last 30 days
custom_expected:
THEN tx and date should be displayed
AND only latest tx and only latest non-paperwork tx should be shown
BUT if no tx is found the label and field should not display

title: Update request date picker to allow selection of future dates
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user is attempting to send a Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks "Send" on the request bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN system should automatically check that bulletins exist for the next 2 Waiver dates
AND system should take weekend waiver logic into account 
AND if one or more of the next 2 bulletins does not yet exist, the system will create one on "Send"
AND "Request Date" datepicker should only allow for the selection of dates for which a bulletin exists on the backend

title: User wants to see Waivers section on Transactions tab of Pro Player Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as Club or BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to a Professional Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Waivers" should be the first collapsible section on the Transactions tab of the Professional Player profile
AND "Waivers" should be expanded by default
AND there should be two subsections within the "Waivers" section - "In Effect" and "History"
AND fields in "In Effect" should be displayed and match the provided wireframe

title: User wants to be able to view detailed history of player's waiver activity during their career
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as Club or BOC user 
AND user has navigated to a Professional Player Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Waivers" collapsible section on player profile
custom_expected:
THEN  "History" subsection within the "Waivers" collapsible section on the player profile should be displayed and should match the provided wireframe
AND Eligible Org should be shown in the "Claimed By" column
AND if more than one Org has claimed the player for this should display as the Eligible Org with a +
AND on hover over the ORG+ the system should show icon that says "Click to view additional Orgs"
AND clicking ORG+ icon should display additional claiming orgs
